tweets.text:
@CamCurat @AquiferChalk Your MP that just been subject to a classic @Defra / @EnvAgency bureaucratic BS response.

According to EA update, 11th Sep, Cam is flowing at just 47% of its long term average.  

Reason? "Groundwater abstraction : Water Industry". Nice try. Try again.

https://t.co/GFs8yKsDeQ

Earlier today, I had a phone call with the @EnvAgency about the flooding from the River Ouzel in Bletchley and Caldecotte.
I've raised concerns from my constituents, discussed future resilience measures against flooding and talk about how I can further help with their work. https://t.co/b9I6PLdPAW

tweets.text: Our #flooding inquiry heard yesterday from people directly affected by floods, and their proposals included the need for @EnvAgency & @DefraGovUK to listen to local groups ‚Äì many thanks to all those who took part and @NatFloodForum for facilitating the session https://t.co/NAbt2Wf4gb

Help your local community by becoming a #Flood Warden - volunteers trained to help & prepare communities at risk of flooding. Find out more https://t.co/eN83CAkUw0 @EnvAgencySE @EdenbridgeTC @EynsfordParish @ShorehamKent #sundridge https://t.co/tgeczPNOYt

urls.title: Flood wardens | Kent Prepared
urls.description: Flood wardens are volunteers trained to help and prepare people in local communities that are at risk of flooding. They play an important role in the preparing a community flood plan and putting it in to practice. They also provide a vital link between a local community and those responsible for responding to a flood. You will be the eyes and ears of the community and will help develop your local flood plan. You can choose to meet with other flood wardens in your community as often as you like, typically

tweets.text: Our MP says: ‚Äú71 abstraction licences relating to 15 chalk streams have been retracted, returning 16 million cubic metres p.a. back to chalk streams and preventing another 8 million cbm p.a. being taken.‚Äù Anyone know where? Making a difference? @AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey

In west Kent? Fancy doing something for your community?

Become a flood warden...

Have a look at this... ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

By the way, that photo's not from today... #floodaware https://t.co/W7UwwMHnqk

We‚Äôre out checking and clearing debris screens in the @EnvAgency patch today. Our screens prevent debris from being carried into covered/restricted parts of watercourse. We check/clear screens routinely to reduce #floodrisk #TeamEA #Friday https://t.co/7SatqDA3Nh

tweets.text:
Great partnership work here with our colleagues @EnvAgencyYNE 

We're committed to protecting the environment and together we're taking a stance against waste crime. https://t.co/AxFCOaIiQI

In the event of a #Flood it is important to know who to call. Make sure you save the @EnvAgency Flood Line number in your phone. Call 0345 988 1188.

#BeFloodReady #BePreparedNotScared https://t.co/D31TF3y8BG

Our October flood newsletter is now out. Features include:

- Timescales extended for property flood grants
- Mytholmroyd flood scheme moves steps closer to completion
- Wardens build flood containers for hillside communities

Read it here: https://t.co/AXTKqO1tJq
@EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/q7h7sEgao5

Lifting and inspection of boats has finished and we have cleared the site at Weston Lock. Canal towpath is now fully reopen. Big thanks to @RCRRescue for its professional support. We are still available to respond to boat owners concerns. Call 03708 506506. https://t.co/zOUPu8edvw
